leftSection_5.title: Prepare, Verify, & Authenticate Your Documents with Our 4-Step Process

items.title: Book a Free Consultation
items.description: We'll schedule a call to discuss your notarisation and attestation needs. You’ll be requested to upload or share your business, visa, or corporate documents.

items.title: Prepare, Verify, & Submit
items.description: Next, our notarisation experts will review everything, from signatures to agreements, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and UAE compliance.

items.title: Notarise & Attest Your Documents
items.description: We’ll handle the entire notarisation process, including legal stamps, translations, and attestations to build local and global recognition.

items.title: Receive Ready-to-Use Documents
items.description: Finally, we’ll courier or upload your fully notarised and attested documents ready for submission to banks, Free Zones, and immigration authorities!

faq.title: Clear Answers, Expert Insights, Hassle Free Consulting Experience

items.question: What are notarisation services in Dubai, UAE?
items.answer: Notarisation services, or notary public services, encompass the authentication, verification, and certification of signatures, agreements, contracts, and documents to ensure compliance with UAE law.

items.question: Why does my business need notary public services in the UAE?
items.answer: Notary public services strengthen your legal validity, prevent forgery or fraud, protect your business interests, build financial resilience, and simplify cross-border transactions.

items.question: Which documents require notarisation for UAE business setup?
items.answer: Common documents include trade licenses, shareholder agreements, powers of attorney, contracts, visas, and foreign documents needing legalisation.

items.question: How long does the notarisation process take?
items.answer: Notarisation and attestation can take anywhere between 1 and 14 days, depending on the type of documents and involved government authorities.

items.question: Can One Nexuz notarise documents from other countries?
items.answer: Absolutely! Our experts handle cross-border documents with proper apostilles, legalisations, and verified translations accepted by UAE authorities.
